titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Leeg, Judgment
CWG11443

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Henderson Circuit Court
June Term 1862
Commonth of Ky Plantiff
vs } Indictment for keeping a Tippling House.
William Leeg Defendent

The defendant appeared in court in proper person and for plea says that he is Guilty of the offence charged in the Indictment but here enter his solemn promise not to be guilty of the like offence again It is therefore adjudged by the court that the Plantiff recover of this defendant the sum of Sixty Dollars the fine fixed by law together with the costs of this prosectuion but in view of the circumstances and of the fact of the defendants appearance in court and acknowlidgment of the offence charged against him and his contrition and repentance therefor, are sufficient grounds to induce the court to favorably recommend him to the Executive of the State for a remission of the fine against him herein.
A True Copy Attest T,, J,, Hopkins C H C C

Commth of Ky
To } copy Order
William Leeg
June Term 1862
